extends java.lang.Object
    This project implements a simple application. Properties from a fixed file can be displayed.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int averagePropertyPrice()
      Calculates and returns the average property price of all the properties that have been viewed so far.

      Returns the total number of properties that have been viewed so far.

      void viewMap()
      This method opens the system's default internet browser The Google maps page should show the current properties location on the map.

      Displays a property, its ID and whether it is a favourite.

    • Method Detail

      • viewProperty

        public void viewProperty​(int index)
        Displays a property, its ID and whether it is a favourite.

      • nextProperty

        public void nextProperty()
        Called when the 'Next' button is clicked. Displays the next property in the portfolio.

      • previousProperty

        public void previousProperty()
        Called when the 'Previuos' button is clicked. Displays the previous property in the portfolio.

      • toggleFavourite

        public void toggleFavourite()
        Called when the ''Toggle Favourite' button is clicked. If the current property is not a favourite, it becomes a favourite. If the current property is a favouite, it becomes not a favourite. Displays whether or not a property is a favourite.

      • viewMap

        public void viewMap()
             throws java.lang.Exception
        This method opens the system's default internet browser The Google maps page should show the current properties location on the map.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getNumberOfPropertiesViewed

        public int getNumberOfPropertiesViewed()
        Returns the total number of properties that have been viewed so far.

      • averagePropertyPrice

        public int averagePropertyPrice()
        Calculates and returns the average property price of all the properties that have been viewed so far.
